alert.note: Alert for Hartford; Tolland; Windham (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 7:16AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Windham, Tolland, eastern Hartford and southeastern Hampden Counties through 800 AM EDT... At 716 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Palmer to near Tolland to near Hebron. Movement was northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... Hartford, Manchester, East Hartford, Enfield, Glastonbury, Vernon, Windsor, Wethersfield, Mansfield, South Windsor, Windham, Bloomfield, Rocky Hill, Willimantic, Suffield, East Longmeadow, Ellington, Tolland, Windsor Locks, and Coventry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle. These storms may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings.
